definition: to flee abroad/to run away/to desert/outflow

sentences.english: Place a hand in front of your mouth when sneezing so that your soul cannot escape.
sentences.chinese: 打喷嚏的时候，用手捂住你的嘴，可以防止灵魂外逃。

sentences.english: With the development of economy, serious circumstance of capital flight appeared in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国随着经济的发展，也出现了严重的资本外逃现象。

sentences.english: Not an emigrant, he hoped, within the sense and spirit of the law.
sentences.chinese: 他希望按法律的意义和精神解释，不属外逃分子之列。

sentences.english: Therefore, our country is faced with the risk of capital flight.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我国面临着资本外逃的风险。

sentences.english: The deposit flight is hardly surprising, considering the dire news coming out of Greece.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到希腊糟糕的消息面，存款外逃并不意外。

definition: to run away/to go into exile
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to run away/to flee in disarray
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to be at large (of a criminal)
escaped criminal/fugitive from the law (criminal suspect on the run)
to pursue/to be after/to hunt down
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
